Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so

am talking about are these coconut water jelly 
cubes with fresh fruit suspended inside it's

gonna end up looking kind of like jewels so cool 
so in Thai this would be called woon nam maprao

polamai sod I know it's a little long but 
woon nam is agar jelly which is what we're gonna

use to set this dessert now maprao is coconut 
water and polamai is fresh fruit so

this video is sponsored by UFC coconut water which 
is my personal favorite brand it is from Thailand

and this is the one I always buy because it's 
the sweetest most fragrant one in my experience

and UFC is a brand that's well known popular in 
Thailand's been around ever since I was a kid so

without further ado let's get started so I've got

going to sprinkle my agar agar powder into here 
my water my coconut water is still cold you don't

our gur powder I have lots of videos on it but

a full boil while stirring frequently if you don't

then once it starts melting it'll kind of form a 
thick gel at the bottom so you want to be stirring

now when you choose coconut water for this it 
really matters the quality because as you're gonna

see it is the main ingredient I'm not adding any 
flavors and extracts anything in here so it's got

to taste good and if you've tried many brands of 
coconut water you will know as I discovered that

the flavors vary a lot right and that's because 
packaged coconut water is actually a mixture of

mature and young coconut water and the ones that 
are sweeter and more fragrant they have a higher

proportion of young coconut water in it which is 
what you want okay now if you want to know more

about the differences between young and mature 
coconuts I have a little documentary on that you

can check it out I'll link to it below but UFC is 
definitely one that is one of the sweeter and more

fragrant ones so now this is fully boiling which 
is what you want I'm gonna turn it off because

you don't want to reduce the volume too much now 
I want to check that all the agar is dissolved

that's really important and what I'm gonna do is 
use a metal spoon because that'll show better any

sort of little granules that's undissolved so 
I dip it I pull it up and I pour it and there I

should see no dots of any specks stuck onto the 
spoon now this cone at water is already quite

sweet but we're making desserts here so I'm 
gonna need to need it to be a little sweeter

because the Hornet water naturally it's it's not 
a super sweet beverage right which is why I prefer

it then drinking soda or juice because it's a 
low sugar beverage so for dessert we're gonna

need to give it a little boost just some sugar 
and you can make this less sweet or more sweet

it's completely up to you it will not affect the 
recipe at all so you can go ahead and give it a

taste before you finalize so once the sugar is all 
dissolved I'm going to add the rest of my coconut

water and I do this so that this will be a little 
bit cooler it won't we won't have to wait for it

for so long to cool down and you don't want to 
use this while it's boiling hot because then

it's going cook your fruit which I discovered the

strawberries yeah they're gonna get mushy if you

cool in it it still needs a little bit of time 
to cool down which is great because we are gonna

need time to prep our fruit anyway but you don't

it reaches room temperature it'll set and then 
you can't use it right so you want to keep it

warm right now it's still quite hot so we'll have 
time but we kind of got a hurry so because I want

using Cube bolt so these are silicone cube molds

and you can buy on Amazon I will link to it in

I've got a variety of fruits here and you want

I do want to talk about using gelatin instead you 
can definitely make it happen a couple things to

keep in mind one you cannot use a mold like this 
with gelatin you want to use individual mold so

each piece should be in a separate container 
because unlike agar that just kind of slides

out gelatin really clings to its container and the 
only way to unmold it is to dip it in hot water to

ever so slightly dissolve the outside before you 
dump it out if you put it in something like this

guess what you can't dissolve the outside because 
the outsides are all attached to each other right

so what you end up doing is you have to dig it 
out with a spoon and then eat it in a bowl like

a pudding so unless you want pudding make sure 
they're in individual molds another thing about

gelatin is there are a few fruits you can't use so 
no pineapple no Kiwis and I also think no figs is

the other one because some fruit will have an 
enzyme that will actually eat the gelatin and

make it so that it won't solidify so if you want 
to use Kiwi or pineapple you want to use the ones

that have been cooked already to do activate the 
enzymes another thing with gelatin is it has to

be cold in order to be solid so while this you 
can like unmold it like this take it to a party

and let it sit out or like pack it up in a little 
container and give it to somebody as a gift with

gelatin you don't want to do that if you want 
to do that you have to keep it cold otherwise

it will melt jealous it's a lot softer this is a 
lot firmer so overall like agar is a lot easier

to deal with gelatin is easier to mix because 
you don't really need to bring it to a boil or

anything like that it dissolves more easily but 
then it becomes finicky at the end so just just

you know just know that before you start trying 
with gelatin alright it's that type of show where

I get to eat I'm gonna cut one up in half actually 
to show you eating our jelly is a bit tricky

because if you try to fork it it will it can sort 
of crumble so if you're just amongst friends you

can just grab it with your hands but I just want 
to cut one open and show you what the inside looks

like Oh No there we go look how pretty that is but 
once you cut it then you again interfere with its

structural integrity and it could fall apart but 
I just want to show you the inside I'm just gonna

eat this one it's so refreshing that subtle flavor 
of the coconut water just goes so well with fresh

fruit it's a little bit tart but still got to 
be sweet strawberries have to be you know still

a good sweet strawberry but with that a little 
bit tartness it just works so well it's it was

amazing to me because coconuts and strawberries 
don't grow in the same parts of the world yet

somehow the flavors work together so well and 
this may look like a lot but trust me when I

was doing recipe testing for this I finished an 
entire plate like this in one sitting because

when you think about it it's just coconut water 
right it's it's not that much coconut water and

just a bunch of fruit and it's so light and you 
and you eat and you're like oh but now I want to

try this one and I don't want to try that one and 
I know I want to go back and try this one again

next thing you know it's all gone so my advice to 
you is make a lot maybe double the recipe because

you're gonna find that you keep going back to it
